}} 'Cut' is an album by Dutch hard rock band Golden Earring, released in 1982
(see 1982 in music). The album spawned the hit song "Twilight Zone," which
reached #1 in the Netherlands and #1 in the United States on Billboard's Hot
Mainstream Rock Tracks.

The album's iconic cover image of the jack of diamonds playing card being
shredded by a bullet is used in the music video of "Twilight Zone" in which the
card represents the life of the rogue espionage agent.

A music video was also made to support the second single released from the
album, "The Devil Made Me Do It." However, the song/video saw limited airplay in
the United States, due to its lyric containing the word "bullshit."
